item.title: Covid-19: Amber list quarantine for fully vaccinated to end on 19 July
item.description: The exemption will apply to vaccinated UK residents and under-18s arriving in England from 19 July.

item.title: Biden defends decision to end Afghan military operation
item.description: "The status quo was not an option," the fourth president to oversee the war said as violence flares.

item.title: Euro 2020: England victory over Denmark watched by 23.86m
item.description: The Euro 2020 tie was the most watched non-news event since the nation's World Cup exit in 2018.

item.title: Euro 2020: England charged by Uefa after 'laser' penalty incident
item.description: Uefa charges England after a laser pointer is directed at Denmark goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel during Wednesday's Euro 2020 semi-final.

item.title: Osaka calls for privacy on return to tennis
item.description: Naomi Osaka calls for "privacy" and "empathy" from the press when she returns, saying she never wants her personal medical history to be scrutinised again.

item.title: 'Neptune' appears in the waves during storm in Newhaven
item.description: The image resembling the Roman god of water was captured as waves crashed over a harbour wall.

item.title: Jovenel Moïse: Haiti seeks masterminds after 'assassins' detained
item.description: The gunmen suspected of shooting President Jovenel Moïse have been killed or detained, police say.

item.title: Teenagers killed in London street stabbings named by police
item.description: Tamim Ian Habimana, 15, and Keane Flynn-Harling, 16, were killed in separate attacks in London.

item.title: Chancellor Rishi Sunak hints at ruling out 8% pension rise
item.description: Rishi Sunak says a decision on the future of the triple lock promise will be "based on fairness".

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Police chief apologises for bomb response failings
item.description: Deputy Chief Constable Ian Pilling says the response to the Manchester Arena attack was "unacceptable".

item.title: Benefits rules to be eased for terminally ill claimants
item.description: Ministers will extend the criteria to fast-track benefits payments to patients in England and Wales

item.title: US woman killed by bear that dragged her from tent in Montana
item.description: Wildlife officials are searching for the bear and say they plan to kill it as it remains a threat.

item.title: Contraceptive mini pill can be sold over the counter in UK
item.description: A prescription is no longer needed for certain progesterone-only pills, the UK's drug regulator says.

item.title: Euro 2020: How Neil Diamond's Sweet Caroline became an accidental football anthem
item.description: A song written by Neil Diamond 52 years ago has become the England team's unofficial Euro 2020 song.

item.title: UK in Afghanistan: 'We have to live with our losses for the rest of our lives'
item.description: The BBC’s Jonathan Beale spoke to one bereaved mother, as the UK removes troops from Afghanistan.

item.title: Queen visits Coronation Street set to mark 60 years of soap
item.description: The royal visitor met cast and crew at the television studios of Britain's longest running soap opera.

item.title: Leonardo Da Vinci bear drawing sells for record £8.8m at auction
item.description: Head of a Bear is more than 500 years old and has set a new record for a Leonardo da Vinci sketch.

item.title: The Apprentice: Claude Littner to miss next series after accident
item.description: Tim Campbell will take his place beside Lord Sugar as he recovers from a serious bike accident.

item.title: World's tallest sandcastle built in Denmark
item.description: Standing at higher than 21m in the Danish town of Blokhus, it is even decorated with Covid particles.

item.title: Nature: Backyard moth spotting rises during lockdown
item.description: Experts are heartened by a new found interest in the "underappreciated and under-threat" insects.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Finally!' say papers after England's thrilling win
item.description: England's thrilling win over Denmark, taking them to the Euro final, leads most of the front pages.

item.title: Gareth Southgate: The England manager - by those who know him best
item.description: As Gareth Southgate prepares for the European Championship final, those who know him best reveal the real England manager.

item.title: The Spice Girls at 25: Here's the story from A to Z
item.description: Easy V doesn't come for free, but this guide to the Spice Girls' career will cost you nothing.

item.title: Australia mice plague: How farmers are fighting back
item.description: There's a debate in Australia about how to deal with a huge plague of mice in the east of the country.

item.title: How de-cluttering grew Facebook Marketplace to 1bn users
item.description: As Covid shut charity shops thrifty second-hand traders shifted online to bag a bargain, in droves.

item.title: The growing Gulf rivalry that's pushing up oil prices
item.description: A public rift between Saudi Arabia and the UAE caused talks between oil exporters to be abandoned.

item.title: Will England's success boost the UK economy?
item.description: The chancellor and others think the tournament could boost consumer confidence as the economy reopens.

item.title: River Nile dam: Why Ethiopia can't stop it being filled
item.description: The massive hydroelectric plant is not like a bath with a tap that can be turned on and off at will.

item.title: Why North America's killer heat scares me
item.description: It's not the new record temperatures that concern the BBC's Roger Harrabin - it's the way they were smashed.

item.title: Peter R de Vries: The Dutch crime reporter who defied death threats
item.description: Hailed as a national hero, Peter R de Vries spent decades investigating the criminal underworld.

item.title: Dying too young: Maps show little has changed in 170 years
item.description: Why do areas with high Covid death rates match places with the worst health in Victorian times?

item.title: Right to repair movement gains power in US and Europe
item.description: Lawmakers and advocates want to give consumers more choice when it comes to fixing devices.

item.title: World number one Barty to face Pliskova in Wimbledon final
item.description: World number one Ashleigh Barty will play Czech eighth seed Karolina Pliskova in the Wimbledon final on Saturday.

item.title: England v Pakistan: New-look hosts show strength in depth to thrash tourists
item.description: With a culture instilled by Eoin Morgan, England's inexperienced side humble Pakistan with an impressive show of strength.

item.title: Covid case in Fury's camp but Wilder fight expected to go ahead
item.description: The 24 July trilogy bout between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder is still going ahead despite a Covid-19 case in the Briton's camp.

item.title: England v Pakistan ODI: Saqib Mahmood takes four wickets in England win
item.description: Fast bowler Saqib Mahmood takes 4-42 as England cruise to victory against Pakistan in the first ODI.

item.title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate as Three Lions make final
item.description: England fans celebrate beating Denmark 2-1 in extra time at Euro 2020 to set up a final against Italy.

item.title: How big will crowd be for final and how can you watch it?
item.description: England will face Italy in the Euro 2020 final on Sunday, but what is the latest ticket situation and how can you watch the game?

item.title: 'The party's over' - Denmark reacts to Euros exit
item.description: Danish media focus on national pride not bitterness after defeat by England in the semi-finals of the Euros.

item.title: Raheem Sterling: 'He was always the best player on the pitch'
item.description: England footballer Raheem Stirling's been described by some as the player of Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: Fans euphoric as England beat Denmark to reach final
item.description: Fans cheered on England as they beat Denmark 2-1 in the Euro 2020 semi-final.

item.title: Watch it again: England v Denmark highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as captain Harry Kane's follow up from a penalty miss sends England through to their first major men's final since 1966, beating Denmark 2-1 after extra time at Wembley.

item.title: England reach Euro 2020 final: How Three Lions victory unfolded on social media
item.description: England beat Denmark 2-1 to reach the final of Euro 2020 - and here's how the match unfolded on social media.

item.title: England into Euros final: Declan Rice learns of new niece moments after win
item.description: Imagine having a baby at the same moment Harry Kane scores the winning goal to reach the Euro 2020 final?

item.title: Fifty-five years, 302 games and more than 140,000 miles - England's pursuit of final number two
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at the statistics behind England's 55-year wait to reach a major tournament final.

item.title: Euro 2020 semi-final England 2-1 Denmark: Harry Kane hits winner as Three Lions reach final
item.description: Battling England come from behind to beat Denmark after extra time on a truly memorable night at Wembley and reach a first major men's tournament final for the first time since 1966.

item.title: Euro 2020 England 2-1 Denmark: Mikkel Damsgaard's 'delightful' free-kick gives Denmark lead
item.description: Mikkel Damsgaard beats goalkeeper Jordan Pickford with a sensational free-kick to put Denmark 1-0 up against England in their semi-final tie at Wembley.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: Fully-vaccinated people in England will be able to avoid self-isolation after travel or contact with a positive case.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Will hairdressers still wear masks? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the rules for pubs, restaurants, festivals and gigs?
item.description: Near-normal service should resume in pubs and restaurants in England from 19 July.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and receptions, and when will they ease?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings are continuing to ease across the UK, so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: The prime minister has announced the next steps for easing social distancing in England.
